page.title: 11Fearn Abbey,Fearn.
page.content: Fearn Abbey dates back to the 13th century.Many of the abbots ensured its development.Patrick Hamilton, one of the Reformers,even visited the Abbey,but by mid 16th century,it was described as being neglected.This century, little change has been made.A new front,very plain,of white marble,was provided,but the proposal in 1925 to reroof the north aisle as a memorial to the Rev. Charles Robertson came to nothing.In the last ten years the interior has been altered again. The walls have been stripped and replaced with simulated stone and a new timber ceiling erected.Services are held every Sunday at 10.45am.with a Sunday school and a Storytime for children.
